sense.name: collection
sense.commentary: assortment, mixed bad, mixture, miscellany, miscellanea, salmagundi, smorgasbord, potpourri, motley - a collection containing a variety of sorts of things
sense.examples: A great assortment of cars was on display. He had a variety of disorders. A variety of religions are practiced in this city. A variety of possibilities are available for the first-year student. The range and variety of his work is amazing.

sense.name: tv show
sense.commentary: a show consisting of a series of short unrelated performances
sense.examples: He likes to stay up late and watch old variety shows. Last night I watched a man eat fire and a comedy sketch on my favorite variety show.

sense.name: a sort
sense.commentary: kind, sort, form - a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality (often in Biology)
sense.examples: Sculpture is one variety of art. You certainly offer a variety of desserts. Varieties are frequently recognized in botany. In biology, a variety is a taxonomic category of species that differ slightly from each other in minor but heritable characteristics.

sense.name: change from the everyday
sense.commentary: a difference that is usually pleasant
sense.examples: He goes to France every year for variety. It is a refreshing change to meet a woman mechanic.
